neighbors.name: Harbin Farm Enterprises LLC
neighbors.claims: Harbin Farm Enterprises, L.L.C. is registered at 2900 East Water Well Road in Salina, Kansas, alongside related Harbin entities (Investments, Partners) at the same address [City-Data Business Directory](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/Salina-KS-H.html). The Harbin family’s farm enterprise has received about $59,600 in federal farm subsidies from 1995–2024, confirming active agricultural operations [EWG Farm Subsidies](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=21&z=1&zip=67401). Nearby landowners (including Harbin’s property) filed a formal protest petition against a proposed battery storage facility at a neighboring site, reflecting this entity’s opposition to industrial energy development on local farmland [KSAL](https://www.ksal.com/4-1-vote-stops-power-storage-facility-project/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Multi-generational local family with diversified businesses (farming, construction) and extensive land holdings; able to mobilize community opposition

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Harbin family leadership directly, acknowledging their heritage and addressing safety/aesthetic concerns; consider involving their construction business in project benefits to build goodwill

neighbors.name: Bradshaw Business Properties LLC
neighbors.claims: Bradshaw Business Properties, L.L.C. is a landholding entity that owns a tract adjoining the proposed energy project area near S. Simpson and E. McReynolds Roads and was identified as a notified property owner during project proceedings [KSAL](https://www.ksal.com/4-1-vote-stops-power-storage-facility-project/). This LLC has no reported farming activity or local business operations, indicating it functions as a passive real-estate investment vehicle (no state subsidies or local industry listings found).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns strategic parcel in project area; financial resources not publicly known, but as an investment LLC it can hire legal counsel or sell strategically

approach_recommendations.engage: Deal directly with the LLC’s owner/representative with a strong financial offer; emphasize the return on investment and offer above-market lease or buyout terms to gain cooperation

overview_summary: The neighboring landowners include a diversified local farming enterprise (Harbin Farm Enterprises LLC), a private family trust (Arnold E. Tillberg Trust), and a land-holding LLC (Bradshaw Business Properties LLC). The Harbin family operates multiple businesses and holds extensive acreage, indicating significant local influence. The trust represents an individual’s farmland estate, while Bradshaw Business Properties appears to be a passive investor with no active farming, suggesting a speculative interest in land value. These entities could present opposition to new development, rooted in preserving agricultural use and property values, though financial incentives might sway the investment-focused owner.
